intro: Julbernardia seretii, commonly known as the African mahogany, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and smooth, glossy bark. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by oval-shaped, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas, contributing to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value and timber potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
